Sentencas: A-site ordered PrBaMn2O5+delta was investigated as a potential cathode for CO2 electrolysis using a La0.9Sr0.1Ga0.8Mg0.2O3 (LSGM) electrolyte.
Titulo: Oxygen deficient layered double perovskite as an active cathode for CO2 electrolysis using a solid oxide conductor

Sentencas: The A-site ordered layered double perovskite, PrBaMn2O5+delta, was found to enhance electrocatalytic activity for CO2 reduction on the cathode side since it supports mixed valent transition metal cations such as Mn, which could provide high electrical conductivity and maintain a large oxygen vacancy content, contributing to fast oxygen ion diffusion.
Titulo: Oxygen deficient layered double perovskite as an active cathode for CO2 electrolysis using a solid oxide conductor

Sentencas: It was found that during the oxidation of the reduced PrBaMn2O5+delta (O5 phase) to PrBaMn2O6+delta (O6 phase), a reversible oxygen switchover in the lattice takes place.
Titulo: Oxygen deficient layered double perovskite as an active cathode for CO2 electrolysis using a solid oxide conductor

Sentencas: In addition, here the successful CO2 electrolysis was measured in LSGM electrolyte with this novel oxide electrode.
Titulo: Oxygen deficient layered double perovskite as an active cathode for CO2 electrolysis using a solid oxide conductor

Sentencas: It was found that this PrBaMn2O5+delta, layered perovskite cathode exhibits a performance with a current density of 0.85 A cm(-2) at 1.5 V and 850 degrees C and the electrochemical properties were also evaluated by impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Oxygen deficient layered double perovskite as an active cathode for CO2 electrolysis using a solid oxide conductor
